metadata.name: Xwizard.EXE Execution From Non-Default Location
metadata.comment: Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory. When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\\\xwizard.exe')) AND lower(process.file.name) = lower('xwizard.exe') AND NOT (startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\system32\\\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\syswow64\\\\')) OR startswith(lower(process.name), lower('c:\\\\windows\\\\winsxs\\\\'))))

output.summary: Detects the execution of Xwizard tool from a non-default directory. When executed from a non-default directory, this utility can be abused in order to side load a custom version of "xwizards.dll".

metadata.objective: False positive: Windows installed on non-C drive References: https://lolbas-project.github.io/lolbas/Binaries/Xwizard/, http://www.hexacorn.com/blog/2017/07/31/the-wizard-of-x-oppa-plugx-style/
